metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5092 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when the thread for a Web Workeris freed from memory prematurely instead of from memory in the main threadwhile cancelling fetch operations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
